src:
Hasil FP1 MotoGP Malaysia: 3 Yamaha Dominan, Rossi Posisi 8
01 Nov 2019, 10:58 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Fabio Quartararo mencatatkan waktu tercepat pada FP1 MotoGP Malaysia 2019. (TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Valentino Rossi menjadi satu-satunya pebalap Yamaha yang terlempar dari posisi lima besar pada latihan bebas pertama (FP1) MotoGP Malaysia 2019 di Sirkuit Sepang, Jumat (1/11).Rossi sebenarnya sempat memimpin jalannya FP1 MotoGP Malaysia 2019 di dua menit akhir sesi latihan. Namun, posisi The Doctor melorot ke posisi delapan setelah tidak mampu memperbaiki catatan waktu di kesempatan terakhirnya.Fabio Quartararo menjadi pebalap tercepat di FP1 dengan menciptakan rekor lap baru di Sirkuit Sepang. Catatan waktu 1 menit 59,027 detik membuat Quartararo mengalahkan rekor lap Dani Pedrosa (1 menit 59,053 detik) yang tercipta pada 2015.Quartararo unggul atas rekan setimnya di Yamaha Petronas, Franco Morbidelli, pada FP1 MotoGP Malaysia 2019. Morbidelli terpaut 0,083 detik dari catatan waktu Quartararo.


Fabio Quartararo mengalahkan Franco Morbidelli di FP1 MotoGP Malaysia 2019. (JORGE GUERRERO / AFP)

Pebalap Yamaha Monster Energy Maverick Vinales berada di posisi ketiga, terpaut 0,191 detik. Vinales unggul atas Marc Marquez di posisi keempat. Marquez sempat terlempar dari posisi sepuluh besar, tapi lap terakhirnya membuat The Baby Alien berada di posisi empat menggeser Andrea Dovizioso.



Posisi enam ditempati Alex Rins, sementara Aleix Espargaro menjadi pebalap Aprilia tercepat di FP1 dengan berada di posisi tujuh. Rossi berada di posisi delapan terpaut 0,866 detik dari catatan waktu Quartararo.Live streaming balapan MotoGP Malaysia 2019, Minggu (3/11), dapat disaksikan di CNNIndonesia.com. Sementara siaran langsung MotoGP Malaysia 2019 dapat diikuti di Trans7.Hasil FP1 MotoGP Malaysia: 1. F. QUARTARARO 1 menit 59,027 detik2. F. MORBIDELLI +0.0833. M. VINALES +0.1914. M. MARQUEZ +0.4905. A. DOVIZIOSO +0.5006. A. RINS +0.5197. A. ESPARGARO +0.8278. V. ROSSI +0.8669. C. CRUTCHLOW +0.94810. J. MILLER +0.969 (har/nva)
text:
Malaysian MotoGP FP1 Results: 3 Dominant Yamaha, Rossi Position 8
01 Nov 2019, 10:58 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Fabio Quartararo records the fastest time in FP1 Malaysia MotoGP 2019. (TOSHIFUMI KITAMURA / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Valentino Rossi became the only Yamaha rider who was thrown from the top five in the first free practice (FP1) MotoGP Malaysia 2019 at the Sepang Circuit, Friday (1/11). in the final two minutes of the training session. However, the Doctor's position slipped to eighth position after being unable to improve the time on his last chance. Fabio Quartararo became the fastest racer in FP1 by creating a new lap record at the Sepang Circuit. A record time of 1 minute 59.027 seconds makes Quartararo beat Dani Pedrosa's lap record (1 minute 59.053 seconds) created in 2015. Quartararo is superior to his Yamaha team-mate at Yamaha Petronas, Franco Morbidelli, on FP1 Malaysian MotoGP 2019. Morbidelli is 0.083 seconds adrift of Quartararo's time record. .


Fabio Quartararo defeats Franco Morbidelli in FP1 Malaysia MotoGP 2019. (JORGE GUERRERO / AFP)

Yamaha Monster Energy driver Maverick Vinales is in third position, 0.191 seconds adrift. Vinales is ahead of Marc Marquez in fourth position. Marquez was knocked out of the top ten, but his final lap put The Baby Alien in fourth position to shift Andrea Dovizioso.



The sixth position is occupied by Alex Rins, while Aleix Espargaro became the fastest Aprilia rider in FP1 by being in seventh position. Rossi is eighth 0.866 seconds adrift of the Quartararo record. Live streaming of the 2019 Malaysian MotoGP race, Sunday (3/11), can be watched on CNNIndonesia.com. While the live broadcast of MotoGP Malaysia 2019 can be followed on Trans7. Results of FP1 Malaysian MotoGP: 1. F. QUARTARARO 1 minute 59.027 seconds. F. MORBIDELLI +0.0833. M. VINALES +0.1914. M. MARQUEZ +0.4905. A. DOVIZIOSO +0.5006. A. RINS +0.5197. A. ESPARGARO +0.8278. V. ROSSI +0.8669. C. CRUTCHLOW +0.94810. J. MILLER +0.969 (har / nva)
